body.p: Bardstown, Nelson County, Kentucky, tailor and postmaster. Maryland native. Married to Mary E. Smith Mattingly in Nelson County in November 1826. Father of Austin Mattingly, Benjamin Mattingly, Eliza Mattingly, John R. Mattingly and Sallie Mattingly. Resident of Nelson County in 1830. Owned two enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1830. Engaged in manufacture and trade in Nelson County in 1840. Owned three enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1840. Tailor in Nelson County in 1850. Household owned thirteen slaves in Nelson County in 1850. Postmaster of Bardstown from September 30, 1856, to August 20, 1863. Owned four enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1860. Household owned an additional eight slaves in Nelson County in 1860.
